text: [Music]
my name is jvis Johnson I'm an
engineering manager on our creator
acquisition team patreon's mission is to
fund the emerging creative class or to
get creators paid there are some
situations where we wouldn't want to to
pay someone like in the case of fraud
because we process millions of payments
each month finding the fraudulent
payment can be like finding a needle in
a hay stack the couple of ways in which
fraud manifests itself in a two-sided
Marketplace like patreon is patrons
paying for Content using stool credit
cards and getting illegitimate access to
it and the other type is just money
Laing maybe it's a Creator who is making
a very large sum on patreon from one
Patron well that seems uh pretty fishy
and that's what's an example of a signal
so whenever a user takes a potentially
suspicious action on the site we
actually fire off a background task to
go investigate that and aws's simple
queuing service is what powers that
system for us one really important piece
of the puzzle is our data science team
they are constantly analyzing signals in
our data to sus out what these frauders
are doing and they do that using
Amazon's redshift offering as our our
data warehouse for doing complex
analysis we run millions of transactions
a month you can imagine that causes
quite a lad on our system so it's
critical we have something like AWS that
can help us easily scale up and down our
evaluation systems obviously there's
going to be what's called a false
positive rate where any of these signals
could apply to perfectly legitimate
creators we take denying of Creator
payment very seriously we want to be
sure that we're right and when we're not
sure we escalated to our trust and
safety teams the combination of an
automated system and a manual system is
very important here because it's
important to maintain trust with
creators given that we've got millions
of transactions processing a month it is
critical that we are easily able to
scale our evaluations and AWS is
critical to that
[Music]
